tool.name: Metadata analysis of all data
tool.description: using MetaCyto's generalized linear model analysis

exit_code.description: Please provide valid additional independent parameter(s) for the GLM analysis.
Please provide valid cluster stat files.
Metadata file MUST have a column called 'filenames', 'fcs_files' or 'fcs_names' containing file names.
Metadata file MUST have ONE column called 'group_name' or 'study_id' containing group names.
Metadata file must have ONE line per group:filename entity.
Metadata file must have ONE line per group:filename entity present in cluster stat files.
One or more parameters provided are not included in the metadata file.

tool.command: Rscript --slave --vanilla '$__tool_directory__/metacyto_glm_all.R' '${metadata}' '${main_var}' '${ga_table}' '${ci}' #if $v.more_var=="TRUE" '${v.other_var}' #end if #if $out_plot=="TRUE" 'pp' '${plot}' #end if 'STAT_FILES' #for f in $input '${f}' #end for

param.name: main_var
param.label: Variable of interest for GLM
param.help: The variable name needs to be included in the metadata file. By default will be the third column (first and second being group and file names) in the metadata file.

param.name: other_var
param.label: Additional variables of interest for GLM
param.help: Please provide a comma-separated list of variables. The variable names need to be included in the metadata file.

data.name: plot
data.label: Forest plot of GLM analysis results of ${input.name}

tool.help:
This tool uses MetaCyto to perform a generalized linear model analysis estimating effect size of independent variables.
-----
**Input files**
This tool requires the output from a MetaCyto clustering analysis, as well as a tabular file containing corresponding metadata (see below for formatting). At least one independent variable must be provided for the generalized linear model.
.. class:: warningmark
The file containing the metadata needs to be formatted according to the example below. Any other formats will not work.
**Parameters**
*Variables for GLM*
Independent variables used to run the GLM analysis. These variables need to be in the metadata file headers with corresponding values for each file in each group.
*Confidence Interval*
Value used to set up the confidence threshold for the GLM analysis.
**Output**
This tool generates a table describing the overall effect size of the independent variables on provided cluster definitions. A forest plot is optionally produced.
-----
**Example**
*Input* - Cluster Stat::
group_name fcs_files cluster_id label fcs_names Marker1 Marker2 ... fraction group1 file1_group1.fcs cluster1 Marker1-|Marker2+|Marker3+ file1_group1.fcs 1.9815 0.2024 ... 0.373 group1 file2_group1.fcs cluster1 Marker1-|Marker2+|Marker3+ file2_group1.fcs 2.3739 0.3377 ... 0.26 ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ...
*Input* - Metadata Table::
group_name fcs_files Parameter1 Parameter2 ... ParameterN group1 file1_group1.fcs red yes ... 15 group1 file2_group1.fcs green yes ... 22 ... ... ... ... ... ...
*Output* - GLM results::
Label Effect_size SE t_value p_value lower upper N Marker1+|Marker3- -1.6370 0.3999 -4.0931 0.0548 -3.3579 0.0837 4 Marker1-|Marker2+|Marker3- -1.6060 0.4586 -3.5014 0.0727 -3.5794 0.3674 4 ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ...
